you should choose a size k2tog knit 3 together 1-2 inches smaller than your actual head p purl measurement st sts stitch stitches materials dpns double-pointed needles yarn 2 skeins of dk weight yarn in your choice of colors yarn used for sample color a madelinetosh tosh dk 100% superwash merino wool color filigree skein is 225 yards/206 meters color b malabrigo yarn finito 100% merino color natural skein is 200 yards/182 9 meters needles us 4 3 5 mm needles 16 circular or dpns us 6 4 0 mm needles 16 circular or dpns us 6 4 0 mm dpns as other notions tapestry needle stitch markers gauge support boylandknitworks@gmail com note on color work directions when the yarn has to be carried more than 5 stitches cross the 2 colors on brim back of work to avoid long floats with color a on smaller needles cast on 96 120 stitches join in round making sure not to twist stitches place marker to indicate beginning of round row 1 work 1x1 rib k1 p1 around continue to work in 1x1 rib until ribbing measures 2 5 3 5 body of hat switch to larger needles follow chart repeating chart 4 5 times per round last row break yarn and thread through remaining stitches with tapestry needle pull tight to close hole fasten_off inside hat and weave in the end finishing weave in all ends wash in warm soapy water and block i prefer to use a balloon because you can inflate it to your required size but you may use a small ball or bowl as well smooth out the crown shaping and even out stitches make pompom make 4 10cm circular pompom form out of cardboard wrap generously with both colors used in hat trim as necessary sew onto top of hat *pompom on sample hat weighs 35g 3 pattern copywright @boyland knitworks 2016 do not sell the pattern or items knitted with this
